revised_title: A Vindication of Doctor Willis's Diatriba de Febribus
tldr: In this article, Richard Lower discusses various medical and anatomical inquiries, including the nature of fevers, the existence of a nervous and nutritious juice, blood circulation, and nutrition. He also examines the role of the blood in the body's structure and nourishment, the function of the lungs in hot animals, and the difference between venal and arterial blood.
